definitions.title: vb. be naked, bare
definitions.body: (Ar. 9ariya be naked; Ph. [[ערה]] [Pi.] lay bare (cf. Bloch Lzb); As. ûru, nakedness, also desert waste (cf. [[[עָרָה]]] infr.) Jäger:BAS ii. 282 and reff.; NH [[עֶרְוׇה]] = BH, Targum [[עִירְיְתָא]]; Syr. 9ryuwto0 in Lexx);—
lay bare Is Is 3:17, Is 22:6, Zep 2:14 (indef. subj.); of laying foundations bare, i.e. tearing down walls, etc. Hb Hab 3:13 (yet on text v. Now), abs. [[עָ֫רוּ עָָרוּ]] Ps 137:7, Ps 137:7.
lay bare by removing contents, empty, water-jar Ge 24:20 (J; + [[אֶל]] loc.), chest 2Ch 24:11.
make naked, of sexual offences Le 20:18, Le 20:19 (both ‖[[גִּלָּה]]).
pour out, [[לַמָּוֶת]] ´[[הֶע]] [[נַפְשׁוֹ]] Is 53:12 (fig. for slay, cf.

definitions.title: Hiph. 2 :
definitions.body: 3 ms. [[יֵעָרֶה עָלֵינוּ רוּחַ]] Is 32:15 (fig.) until there be poured upon us a spirit from on high.

definitions.title: Hithp. 1.
definitions.body: Impf. 2 fs. [[תִּתְעָרִָי]] La 4:21 thou shalt make thyself naked (of Edom under fig. of drunken woman).
Pt. [[מִתְעָרֶה]] Ps 37:35 usu. pouring himself, i.e. spreading himself out like a tree (Bae doubts; Du [[מִתְעַלֶּה]] lifting himself up, cf. LXX).
